page.title: 06Transport
page.content: The Leeds-Liverpool Canal is one of the main features of this D-Block. Just over four miles of this 127 mile waterway winds its way through the block linking Clayton-le-Moors, Church and Rishton, passing through farmland an industrial areas. A walk along the towpath shows that the prosperity of the 'Canal Age' is long gone. Buildings, once hives of activity, lie silent, falling into disrepair - some with the decaying machinery still inside. There are however signs that the canal is waking up again. Fish are now to be found in the once polluted water. Cruisers and converted barges ply their way with clutches of canoes. Old buildings are slowly giving way to new indutries and housing, injecting a fresh life to a much neglected area.
